title_en: Trade unions: IG Metall makes demands on tariffs
summary_en:
IG Metall presents a recommendation on the requirements for the autumn round of tariffs for 3.9 million workers in the metallurgical and electrical industries.
The Trade Union Council will discuss the recommendation with Christian Benner.
The union is likely to demand a significant increase in wages due to rising consumer prices.
Employers claim that the tense economic situation in Germany does not allow for a significant increase in wages.
Employers in Baden-Wuerttemberg demand zero wages.
The head of IG-Metall, Benner, rejects the demand of Baden-W√ºrttemberg employers to hold a zero round.
IG Metall strives to ensure compliance with its wage requirements through labor disputes.
The recommendation of the IG-Metall board is not yet a final requirement, and the issue will be discussed in the regional tariff commissions.

title_en: Ver.di calls for a precautionary strike at major German ports
summary_en:
The delay at the terminals causes a warning strike in major German ports.
Port workers in the north of the country have suspended work due to the strike.
In the port of Hamburg, loading and unloading operations are largely paralyzed.
Port staff in Hamburg, Bremen, Bremerhaven, Break and Emden have been called to cease work.
The third round of collective bargaining will take place on Monday and Tuesday in Hamburg.
The strikes of the port workers last week clearly demonstrated their support for their demands.
Wage differences between different groups should be reduced.
The strike affected, in particular, four container terminals of logistics companies.
The decree requires an increase in hourly wages by three euros retroactively for employees.

title_en: Collective bargaining: a warning strike has paralyzed the operation of a number of ports in northern Germany
summary_en:
Workers at the northern ports went on strike before the start of the third round of collective bargaining.
The warning strike caused damage to the port of Hamburg and the transshipment of containers.
The Verdi trade union has called on port workers in several cities to go on strike.
Verdi demands an increase in hourly wages and shift fees for employees.
The Central Association of German Port Companies has proposed a wage increase, but it does not meet the requirements of the trade union.
On Monday morning, many workers at the northern ports went on strike as a warning before the start of the third round of collective bargaining.
